intro: Chamaerhodos altaica var. orientalis, commonly known as the Eastern Siberian fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Eastern Siberia and northern Mongolia. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as tundra, grasslands, and along roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native range.
